page.title: 14PUPILS' SMOKING HABITS contd
page.content: The average age for starting to smoke was 12 years.Five pupils smoked since they were 7, one since 8 and six since 9 years old, representing 9.8% of all pupils smoking by 10th birthday.32.8% smokers said their habit damaged their sporting ability.92.7% of all pupils said they were aware of the health risks in smoking.47.2% of fathers of all pupils smoked and 40.7% of mothers.Parents who smoke have slightly higher chance of having childeren who smoke.Most non-smokers said the legal age for buying cigarettes should be raised to at least 18 years.Most smokers wanted it to be about their current age.From this information three causes for concern stand out:the very young age at which many start smoking;2 that as many girls smoke as boys;3.More young people smoke than their parents.
